The Facebook post was published on March: 2020, and included a misleading caption in Indonesian that translated to English as "According to WHO smoking can prevent someone from getting infected with the CORONAVIRUS."
The claim was refuted by the WHO on its: based Twitter account on March 10, 2020, stating that smoking does not protect people from coronavirus infection. The WHO emphasized that smoking can actually cause health conditions that increase the risk of severe COVID-19 illness.
The WHO: s official website clearly states that smoking is not effective against COVID-19 and can be harmful. The website also provides suggestions to prevent the spread of the disease, none of which mention smoking as a preventive measure.
The WHO posted a video on Twitter titled: 7 simple steps to protect yourself and others from #COVID19," which does not include smoking as one of the recommended steps.
